fields.value: Law Enforcement Management and Administrative Statistics (LEMAS), 1990
Sample Survey of Law Enforcement Agencies

authorName.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value: This survey, the second in the Bureau of Justice Statistics' program on Law Enforcement and Administrative Statistics (LEMAS), presents information on four types of general-purpose law enforcement agencies: state police, local police, special police, and sheriff's departments. Variables include size of the population served by the police or sheriff's department, levels of employment and spending, various functions of the department, average salary levels for uniformed officers, and other matters related to management and personnel.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.E. Social Institutions and Behavior, Crime and the Criminal Justice System

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

seriesName.value: Law Enforcement Management and Administrative Statistics (LEMAS) Series

value: All state, local, special, and sheriff's law enforcement agencies in the United States.

fields.value: All primary general-purpose state police agencies were chosen. All sheriff's departments, local police departments, and special agencies with more than 100 sworn officers were chosen. A stratified random sampling method was used in selecting smaller agencies.
